variantrule.name: Hindering Traits
entries: Even the strongest heroes can have things that hold them back. These flaws have the opportunity make the character's story more interesting as they struggle to overcome challenges unique to them. The rules below are an optional way to encourage players to build flawed characters.
The Dungeon Master can decide to implement these rule in one of the following ways during character creation:

items: Each player is forced to take a number of Hindering traits at the begining of the game.
The players can freely choose or roll for a number of Hindering traits.
The DM can incentivize players to take Hindering traits by offering rewards for taking them. Examples of rewards could include ASI, Feats or Charms.

entries: The DM may also decide to assign certain traits to characters if they experience strong traumas that could lead to the trait developing.

entries.name: Hindering Trait Tables
entries: The DM may choose which of the below tables are available and their respective rewards, if any.

rows: {@b Weak.} Your Strength score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Clumsy.} Your Dexterity score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Glass Bones.} Your Constitution score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Absent Minded.} Your Intelligence score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Clueless.} Your Wisdom score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Weak Willed.} Your Charisma score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).

{@b Inept.} Randomly choose a skill, or have the DM choose. You cannot have a modifier higher than 0 for this skill, regardless of proficiency or expertise, and you gain disadvantage on any rolls made with this skill.
{@b Short Sighted.} You have disadvantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks and attack rolls against targets more than 30 feet away.
{@b Long Sighted.} You have disadvantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks and attack rolls against targets less than 10 feet away.

{@b Phobia.} You have an irrational fear of a particular thing, such as dogs, darkness or large bodies of water. When you are confronted by this thing, you must succeed on a DC12 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} by it until it is no longer visible.

{@b Infatuation.} You adore a particular type of creature or person, such as cute kittens or people with a specific hair colour. When you are confronted by a creature belonging to this group, you must make a DC12 Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, you become {@condition charmed} by the creature and wish to spend time with them, regardless of other any other pressing matters. This lasts for 1 hour or until you take damage.

{@b Vice.} You are addicted to a particular substance or activity, such as alcohol or gambling. Whenever you finish a long rest without having indulged in your vice since the last long rest, you must suceeded on a DC12 Charisma check or gain a level of exhaustion.
{@b Blind.} You permanently have the {@condition blinded} condition.
{@b Deaf.} You permanently have the {@condition deafened} condition.
{@b Illiterate.} You cannot read any languages without magic assistance, nor can you learn to.

{@b Missing or Paralyzed Leg.*} Your movement speeds (except flying), jumping distance and jumping height are all halved (rounded down). Additionally you have disadvantge on any checks or saving throws that require the use of your legs, such as climbing.*

{@b Missing or Paralyzed Arm.*} You only have one hand for items, weapons and spells. Additionally you have disadvantage on any checks or saving throws that require the use of arms or hands, such as climbing.*

variantrule.name: Potions of Unknown Effect
entries: Alchemy is a complex science and few mortals can be expected to truly understand everything there is to know. Fortunately, knowing things is not always required to do things.

entries.name: Creating the Potion
entries: You can spend 1 hour using Alchemist's Supplies to attempt to create a potion. You must also provide some special component harvested from a creature of CR 1 or above, such as a giant scorpion stinger or a cyclops eye, creating the potion consumes this component. When you make the potion, make a Wisdom (Alchemist's Supplies) check and consult the table below to determine the result. Regardless of what you roll, you do not know the effect of the potion until it is consumed.

rows: You fail to make any drinkable liquid.
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 2d100dh1|2d100}, take the lowest roll and consult the Potion Effects table below.
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 1d100} and consult the Potion Effects table below.
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, {@dice 2d100dl1|2d100}, take the highest roll and consult the Potion Effects table below.
The potion has two effects. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 4d100dl2|4d100}, take the two highest rolls and consult the Potion Effects table below.
The drinker instantly drops to 0 hitpoints and falls {@condition unconscious}, they are automatically stabilised.
The drinker takes {@dice 2d6+2} poison damage and gains the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.
The drinker takes {@dice 1d6+1} poison damage and gains the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.
The drinker immediately vomits and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.
The drinker gains a level of exhaustion.
The drinker falls {@condition unconscious} and cannot be revived by non-magical means for {@dice 1d4} minutes.
The drinker feels a sudden urge to empty their bowels and has disadvantage on ability checks until they do so.
The drinker feels a sudden urge to empty their bladder and has disadvantage on ability checks until they do so.

The drinker's feet are unable to gain any traction. If the creature is standing on their feet at the end of each of their turns, they must make a DC14 Dexterity save or become {@condition prone}. This lasts for 1 minute.

The drinker takes {@dice 1d6} cold damage and all their fingers fall off. They are unable to perform any action that would require the use of fingers, such as making a weapon attack. Their fingers regrow after {@dice 2d4} minutes.
All wooden items become invisible to the drinker for 1 hour. They have disadvantage when using items or weapons made mostly of wood or when attacking creatures made of, or wearing, mostly wood.
All metal items become invisible to the drinker for 1 hour. They have disadvantage when using items or weapons made mostly of metal or when attacking creatures made of, or wearing, mostly metal.
The drinker cannot speak in any language for 1 hour.
The drinker is {@condition blinded} by shapes and colours only they can see for 1d4 minutes.
The drinker is hit by the effects of {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|phb}. They automatically fail the save.

The first person the drinker sees, the drinker believes they are that person for {@dice 2d4} minutes. They believe the original person is trying to impersonate them and cannot be convinced otherwise until the effect wears off.
The drinker is {@condition charmed} by the first creature they see after drinking for {@dice 1d4} hours.
The drinker's skin changes a random colour that is unnatural for their race. This lasts until the end of the next long rest.
The drinker's hair turns a shocking white. This lasts until the end of the next long rest.
The hair on the drinker's head grows by {@dice 1d4} inches, even if they didn't have any to begin with.

The drinker has an epiphany and they suddenly understands the meaning of life, the universe and everything. They, and anyone they tell, suddenly forget it after {@dice 1d6} seconds, any attempts to write it down or record it are also destroyed.
The drinker's height permanently increases by {@dice 2d4} inches.
The drinker's height permanently decreases by {@dice 2d4} inches.
The drinker believes anything they are told by anyone they consider friendly for one minute.
The drinker can only communicate through rhyme and song for one hour. This applies even to writing.
The drinker becomes younger by {@dice 2d4} years.
The drinker becomes older by {@dice 2d4} years.
The drinker cannot knowingly lie for one hour, as if under the effects of the {@spell zone of truth|phb} spell.
The drinker believes they are currently in a dream and nothing they see or hear is actually real for one minute.
The drinker can sense the innermost thoughts and emotions of every plant within a 120ft radius for 10 minutes. They do not necessarily understand them.
The drinker can see their own skeleton for 10 minutes.

The drinker realises they are in a game but no one believes them. They can choose to reroll a single check or save they make within 1 hour. The new roll must be made before the outcome of the first roll is known. After the hour, the drinker forgets all about the outer world as does anyone they told.
The drinker grows an extra arm and hand for 10 minutes, they are able to use this arm as a bonus action to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only) or {@action Use an Object} action.
The drinker learns a new language chosen by the DM and can speak it fluently for {@dice 2d4} days, after which they completey forget it.
Any creature within 10ft of the drinker must make a Wisdom save against the drinker's Charisma or be {@condition charmed} by them for one hour.
The drinker's nails grow long and sharp, their unarmed attacks become {@dice 1d10} + their Strength modifier slashing damage for one minute.
The drinker gains the effects of the {@spell Polymorph} spell for up to 1 hour, they are turned into a random beast of CR1 or lower. The DM decides the beast.

variantrule.name: Pocket Sand
entries: Sometimes, you need to fight dirty. If your character has a free hand and quick access to a handful of sand or grit, such as with a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or being on sandy terrain, they can use it to gain a small advantage in combat.

As an action, the sand can be thrown at a creature within 5ft of you that has exposed eyes. The creature must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded|phb} until the start of its next turn.
